message.content:
cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT 

This paper is about a variant of fictitious play, which is a well-known heuristic for playing repeated games. The paper discusses the Hannan consistency of this variant, which is a concept in game theory. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.GT (Game Theory and Mechanism Design). Additionally, the paper uses anti-concentration results from Littlewood-Offord theory, which is related to probability theory and combinatorics, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely category. The paper also discusses regret matching and smooth fictitious play, which are algorithms used in reinforcement learning, indicating that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another possible category. Finally, the paper uses sampling techniques, which are commonly used in data science and statistics, suggesting that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.IT (Information Theory) are also possible categories.
